channel.title: attack.credential_access on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.credential_access on My New Hugo Site

item.title: LSASS Access from White-Listed Processes
item.description: Detects a possible process memory dump that uses the white-listed filename like TrolleyExpress.exe as a way to dump the lsass process memory without Microsoft Defender interference

item.title: LSASS Memory Access by Tool Named Dump
item.description: Detects a possible process memory dump based on a keyword in the file name of the accessing process

item.title: Process Access via TrolleyExpress Exclusion
item.description: Detects a possible process memory dump that uses the white-listed Citrix TrolleyExpress.exe filename as a way to dump the lsass process memory

item.title: Create Volume Shadow Copy with Powershell
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to access or create a copy of the Active Directory domain database in order to steal credential information

item.title: Suspicious Process Writes Ntds.dit
item.description: Detects suspicious processes that write (copy) a Active Directory database (ntds.dit) file

item.title: Request A Single Ticket via PowerShell
item.description: utilize native PowerShell Identity modules to query the domain to extract the Service Principal Names for a single computer. This behavior is typically used during a kerberos or silver ticket attack. A successful execution will output the SPNs for the endpoint in question.

item.title: Findstr GPP Passwords
item.description: Look for the encrypted cpassword value within Group Policy Preference files on the Domain Controller. This value can be decrypted with gpp-decrypt.

item.title: Password Cracking with Hashcat
item.description: Execute Hashcat.exe with provided SAM file from registry of Windows and Password list to crack against

item.title: Powershell Install a DLL in System32
item.description: Uses PowerShell to install a DLL in System32

item.title: Suspicious Connection to Remote Account
item.description: Adversaries with no prior knowledge of legitimate credentials within the system or environment may guess passwords to attempt access to accounts. Without knowledge of the password for an account, an adversary may opt to systematically guess the password using a repetitive or iterative mechanism

item.title: Suspicious Reg Add Open Command
item.description: Threat actors performed dumping of SAM, SECURITY and SYSTEM registry hives using DelegateExecute key

item.title: Mimikatz MemSSP Default Log File Creation
item.description: Detects Mimikatz MemSSP default log file creation

item.title: Accessing Encrypted Credentials from Google Chrome Login Database
item.description: Adversaries may acquire credentials from web browsers by reading files specific to the target browser. Web browsers commonly save credentials such as website usernames and passwords so that they do not need to be entered manually in the future. Web browsers typically store the credentials in an encrypted format within a credential store.

item.title: Dump Credentials from Windows Credential Manager With PowerShell
item.description: Adversaries may search for common password storage locations to obtain user credentials. Passwords are stored in several places on a system, depending on the operating system or application holding the credentials.

item.title: Enumerate Credentials from Windows Credential Manager With PowerShell
item.description: Adversaries may search for common password storage locations to obtain user credentials. Passwords are stored in several places on a system, depending on the operating system or application holding the credentials.

item.title: Extracting Information with PowerShell
item.description: Adversaries may search local file systems and remote file shares for files containing insecurely stored credentials. These can be files created by users to store their own credentials, shared credential stores for a group of individuals, configuration files containing passwords for a system or service, or source code/binary files containing embedded passwords.

item.title: Suspicious Unattend.xml File Access
item.description: Attempts to access unattend.xml, where credentials are commonly stored, within the Panther directory where installation logs are stored. If these files exist, their contents will be displayed. They are used to store credentials/answers during the unattended windows install process

item.title: Exploit SamAccountName Spoofing with Kerberos
item.description: The attacker creates a computer object using those permissions with a password known to her. After that she clears the attribute ServicePrincipalName on the computer object. Because she created the object (CREATOR OWNER), she gets granted additional permissions and can do many changes to the object.

item.title: NPPSpy Hacktool Usage
item.description: Detects the use of NPPSpy hacktool that stores cleartext passwords of users that logged in to a local file

item.title: LSASS Access from Program in Suspicious Folder
item.description: Detects process access to LSASS memory with suspicious access flags and from a suspicious folder

item.title: Suspicious LSASS Process Clone
item.description: Detects a suspicious LSASS process process clone that could be a sign of process dumping activity

item.title: Suspicious Dump64.exe Execution
item.description: Detects when a user bypasses Defender by renaming a tool to dump64.exe and placing it in a Visual Studio folder

item.title: Azure Kubernetes Admission Controller
item.description: Identifies when an admission controller is executed in Azure Kubernetes. A Kubernetes Admission controller intercepts, and possibly modifies, requests to the Kubernetes API server. The behavior of this admission controller is determined by an admission webhook (MutatingAdmissionWebhook or ValidatingAdmissionWebhook) that the user deploys in the cluster. An adversary can use such webhooks as the MutatingAdmissionWebhook for obtaining persistence in the cluster. For example, attackers can intercept and modify the pod creation operations in the cluster and add their malicious container to every created pod. An adversary can use the webhook ValidatingAdmissionWebhook, which could be used to obtain access credentials. An adversary could use the webhook to intercept the requests to the API server, record secrets, and other sensitive information.

item.title: Google Cloud Kubernetes Admission Controller
item.description: Identifies when an admission controller is executed in GCP Kubernetes. A Kubernetes Admission controller intercepts, and possibly modifies, requests to the Kubernetes API server. The behavior of this admission controller is determined by an admission webhook (MutatingAdmissionWebhook or ValidatingAdmissionWebhook) that the user deploys in the cluster. An adversary can use such webhooks as the MutatingAdmissionWebhook for obtaining persistence in the cluster. For example, attackers can intercept and modify the pod creation operations in the cluster and add their malicious container to every created pod. An adversary can use the webhook ValidatingAdmissionWebhook, which could be used to obtain access credentials. An adversary could use the webhook to intercept the requests to the API server, record secrets, and other sensitive information.

item.title: ADCS Certificate Template Configuration Vulnerability
item.description: Detects certificate creation with template allowing risk permission subject

item.title: ADCS Certificate Template Configuration Vulnerability with Risky EKU
item.description: Detects certificate creation with template allowing risk permission subject and risky EKU

item.title: Account Lockout
item.description: Identifies user account which has been locked because the user tried to sign in too many times with an incorrect user ID or password.

item.title: Change to Authentication Method
item.description: Change to authentication method could be an indicated of an attacker adding an auth method to the account so they can have continued access.

item.title: User Access Blocked by Azure Conditional Access
item.description: Detect access has been blocked by Conditional Access policies. The access policy does not allow token issuance which might be sightsâ‰ˆ of unauthorizeed login to valid accounts.

item.title: Process Dump via RdrLeakDiag.exe
item.description: Detects a process memory dump performed by RdrLeakDiag.exe

item.title: Azure Keyvault Secrets Modified or Deleted
item.description: Identifies when secrets are modified or deleted in Azure.

item.title: Azure Keyvault Key Modified or Deleted
item.description: Identifies when a Keyvault Key is modified or deleted in Azure.

item.title: Azure Key Vault Modified or Deleted.
item.description: Identifies when a key vault is modified or deleted.

item.title: ADCSPwn Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by ADCSPwn, a tool to escalate privileges in an active directory network by coercing authenticate from machine accounts and relaying to the certificate service

item.title: PowerShell SAM Copy
item.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell scripts accessing SAM hives

item.title: Automated Collection Command Prompt
item.description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.

item.title: AWS Route 53 Domain Transfer Lock Disabled
item.description: Detects when a transfer lock was removed from a Route 53 domain. It is recommended to refrain from performing this action unless intending to transfer the domain to a different registrar.

item.title: AWS Route 53 Domain Transferred to Another Account
item.description: Detects when a request has been made to transfer a Route 53 domain to another AWS account.

item.title: Discover Private Keys
item.description: Adversaries may search for private key certificate files on compromised systems for insecurely stored credential

item.title: CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 Exploits by Sourgum
item.description: Detects patterns as noticed in exploitation of Windows CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 vulnerability and DevilsTongue malware by threat group Sourgum

item.title: CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 Exploits by Sourgum
item.description: Detects patterns as noticed in exploitation of Windows CVE-2021-31979 CVE-2021-33771 vulnerability and DevilsTongue malware by threat group Sourgum

item.title: Suspicious Serv-U Process Pattern
item.description: Detects a suspicious process pattern which could be a sign of an exploited Serv-U service

item.title: Windows Pcap Drivers
item.description: Detects Windows Pcap driver installation based on a list of associated .sys files.

item.title: Harvesting of Wifi Credentials Using netsh.exe
item.description: Detect the harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe

item.title: Process Dump via Rundll32 and Comsvcs.dll
item.description: Detects a process memory dump performed via ordinal function 24 in comsvcs.dll

item.title: Kerberos Network Traffic RC4 Ticket Encryption
item.description: Detects kerberos TGS request using RC4 encryption which may be indicative of kerberoasting

item.title: Audit CVE Event
item.description: Detects events generated by Windows to indicate the exploitation of a known vulnerability (e.g. CVE-2020-0601)

item.title: Windows Credential Editor Registry
item.description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

item.title: SecurityXploded Tool
item.description: Detects the execution of SecurityXploded Tools

item.title: RottenPotato Like Attack Pattern
item.description: Detects logon events that have characteristics of events generated during an attack with RottenPotato and the like

item.title: Cisco Collect Data
item.description: Collect pertinent data from the configuration files

item.title: Cisco Crypto Commands
item.description: Show when private keys are being exported from the device, or when new certificates are installed

item.title: Cisco Show Commands Input
item.description: See what commands are being input into the device by other people, full credentials can be in the history

item.title: Cisco Sniffing
item.description: Show when a monitor or a span/rspan is setup or modified

item.title: DPAPI Domain Backup Key Extraction
item.description: Detects tools extracting LSA secret DPAPI domain backup key from Domain Controllers

item.title: DPAPI Domain Master Key Backup Attempt
item.description: Detects anyone attempting a backup for the DPAPI Master Key. This events gets generated at the source and not the Domain Controller.

item.title: LSASS Access from Non System Account
item.description: Detects potential mimikatz-like tools accessing LSASS from non system account

item.title: SAM Registry Hive Handle Request
item.description: Detects handles requested to SAM registry hive

item.title: Network Sniffing
item.description: Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

item.title: Possible DC Shadow
item.description: Detects DCShadow via create new SPN

item.title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

item.title: LSASS Memory Dumping
item.description: Detect creation of dump files containing the memory space of lsass.exe, which contains sensitive credentials. Identifies usage of Sysinternals procdump.exe to export the memory space of lsass.exe which contains sensitive credentials.

item.title: Capture a Network Trace with netsh.exe
item.description: Detects capture a network trace via netsh.exe trace functionality

item.title: Brute Force
item.description: Detects many authentication failures from one source to one destination which is may indicate Brute Force activity

item.title: Mimikatz through Windows Remote Management
item.description: Detects usage of mimikatz through WinRM protocol by monitoring access to lsass process by wsmprovhost.exe.

item.title: Judgement Panda Credential Access Activity
item.description: Detects Russian group activity as described in Global Threat Report 2019 by Crowdstrike

item.title: iOS Implant URL Pattern
item.description: Detects URL pattern used by iOS Implant

item.title: Activity Related to NTDS.dit Domain Hash Retrieval
item.description: Detects suspicious commands that could be related to activity that uses volume shadow copy to steal and retrieve hashes from the NTDS.dit file remotely

item.title: Cmdkey Cached Credentials Recon
item.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials

item.title: Invocation of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
item.description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe, which can be used for various attacks against the NTDS database (NTDS.DIT)

item.title: NotPetya Ransomware Activity
item.description: Detects NotPetya ransomware activity in which the extracted passwords are passed back to the main module via named pipe, the file system journal of drive C is deleted and windows eventlogs are cleared using wevtutil

item.title: Rubeus Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Rubeus hack tool

item.title: Suspicious SYSVOL Domain Group Policy Access
item.description: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL

item.title: Suspicious Use of Procdump on LSASS
item.description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we’re also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.

item.title: LSASS Access Detected via Attack Surface Reduction
item.description: Detects Access to LSASS Process

item.title: Detection of SafetyKatz
item.description: Detects possible SafetyKatz Behaviour

item.title: QuarksPwDump Dump File
item.description: Detects a dump file written by QuarksPwDump password dumper

item.title: WCE wceaux.dll Access
item.description: Detects wceaux.dll access while WCE pass-the-hash remote command execution on source host

item.title: SAM Dump to AppData
item.description: Detects suspicious SAM dump activity as cause by QuarksPwDump and other password dumpers

item.title: Credentials Dumping Tools Accessing LSASS Memory
item.description: Detects process access LSASS memory which is typical for credentials dumping tools

item.title: Kerberos Manipulation
item.description: This method triggers on rare Kerberos Failure Codes caused by manipulations of Kerberos messages

item.title: Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN

item.title: Password Dumper Remote Thread in LSASS
item.description: Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage. The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.

item.title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System
item.description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system

item.title: Mimikatz Use
item.description: This method detects mimikatz keywords in different Eventlogs (some of them only appear in older Mimikatz version that are however still used by different threat groups)

item.title: Accessing WinAPI in PowerShell for Credentials Dumping
item.description: Detects Accessing to lsass.exe by Powershell

item.title: Antivirus Password Dumper Detection
item.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a password dumper

item.title: Azure Kubernetes Network Policy Change
item.description: Identifies when a Azure Kubernetes network policy is modified or deleted.

item.title: Azure Kubernetes RoleBinding/ClusterRoleBinding Modified and Deleted
item.description: Detects the creation or patching of potential malicious RoleBinding/ClusterRoleBinding.

item.title: CrackMapExecWin
item.description: Detects CrackMapExecWin Activity as Described by NCSC

item.title: Cred Dump-Tools Named Pipes
item.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via specific named pipes

item.title: Credential Dumping by LaZagne
item.description: Detects LSASS process access by LaZagne for credential dumping.

item.title: Credential Dumping by Pypykatz
item.description: Detects LSASS process access by pypykatz for credential dumping.

item.title: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution
item.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events

item.title: Credentials from Password Stores - Keychain
item.description: Detects passwords dumps from Keychain

item.title: Credentials In Files
item.description: Detecting attempts to extract passwords with grep

item.title: Credentials In Files
item.description: Detecting attempts to extract passwords with grep and laZagne

item.title: DIT Snapshot Viewer Use
item.description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool. Seems to be a tool for ransomware groups.

item.title: Dropping Of Password Filter DLL
item.description: Detects dropping of dll files in system32 that may be used to retrieve user credentials from LSASS

item.title: Dumpert Process Dumper
item.description: Detects the use of Dumpert process dumper, which dumps the lsass.exe process memory

item.title: Dumping Process via Sqldumper.exe
item.description: Detects process dump via legitimate sqldumper.exe binary

item.title: Esentutl Gather Credentials
item.description: Conti recommendation to its affiliates to use esentutl to access NTDS dumped file. Trickbot also uses this utilities to get MSEdge info via its module pwgrab.

item.title: Esentutl Volume Shadow Copy Service Keys
item.description: Detects the volume shadow copy service initialization and processing via esentutl. Registry keys such as HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\VSS\Diag\VolSnap\Volume are captured.

item.title: GALLIUM Artefacts
item.description: Detects artefacts associated with activity group GALLIUM - Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center indicators released in December 2019.

item.title: Generic Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask

item.title: Google Cloud Kubernetes RoleBinding
item.description: Detects the creation or patching of potential malicious RoleBinding. This includes RoleBindings and ClusterRoleBinding.

item.title: Google Cloud Kubernetes Secrets Modified or Deleted
item.description: Identifies when the Secrets are Modified or Deleted.

item.title: Grabbing Sensitive Hives via Reg Utility
item.description: Dump sam, system or security hives using REG.exe utility

item.title: Guacamole Two Users Sharing Session Anomaly
item.description: Detects suspicious session with two users present

item.title: GUI Input Capture - macOS
item.description: Detects attempts to use system dialog prompts to capture user credentials

item.title: Hack Tool User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings user by hack tools in proxy logs

item.title: Hydra Password Guessing Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Hydra password guessing hack tool

item.title: LSASS Memory Dump
item.description: Detects process LSASS memory dump using Mimikatz, NanoDump, Invoke-Mimikatz, Procdump or Taskmgr based on the CallTrace pointing to ntdll.dll, dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll for win10, server2016 and up.

item.title: LSASS Memory Dump File Creation
item.description: LSASS memory dump creation using operating systems utilities. Procdump will use process name in output file if no name is specified

item.title: Lsass Memory Dump via Comsvcs DLL
item.description: Detects adversaries leveraging the MiniDump export function from comsvcs.dll via rundll32 to perform a memory dump from lsass.

item.title: Mimikatz Command Line
item.description: Detection well-known mimikatz command line arguments

item.title: Mimikatz DC Sync
item.description: Detects Mimikatz DC sync security events

item.title: Mimikatz Detection LSASS Access
item.description: Detects process access to LSASS which is typical for Mimikatz (0x1000 PROCESS_QUERY_ LIMITED_INFORMATION, 0x0400 PROCESS_QUERY_ INFORMATION “only old versions”, 0x0010 PROCESS_VM_READ)

item.title: Mimikatz Kirbi File Creation
item.description: Detects the creation of files that contain Kerberos tickets based on an extension used by the popular tool Mimikatz

item.title: Network Sniffing
item.description: Detects the usage of tooling to sniff network traffic. An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

item.title: NTLM Brute Force
item.description: Detects common NTLM brute force device names

item.title: PetitPotam Suspicious Kerberos TGT Request
item.description: Detect suspicious Kerberos TGT requests. Once an attacer obtains a computer certificate by abusing Active Directory Certificate Services in combination with PetitPotam, the next step would be to leverage the certificate for malicious purposes. One way of doing this is to request a Kerberos Ticket Granting Ticket using a tool like Rubeus. This request will generate a 4768 event with some unusual fields depending on the environment. This analytic will require tuning, we recommend filtering Account_Name to the Domain Controller computer accounts.

item.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity
item.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL

item.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity - Zeek
item.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL. Based on the SIGMA rules/windows/builtin/win_impacket_secretdump.yml

item.title: Possible PetitPotam Coerce Authentication Attempt
item.description: Detect PetitPotam coerced authentication activity.

item.title: Possible SPN Enumeration
item.description: Detects Service Principal Name Enumeration used for Kerberoasting

item.title: PowerShell Credential Prompt
item.description: Detects PowerShell calling a credential prompt

item.title: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS
item.description: Detects a Get-Process command on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity

item.title: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS in ScriptBlock
item.description: Detects a Get-Process command on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity

item.title: Process Dump via Comsvcs DLL
item.description: Detects process memory dump via comsvcs.dll and rundll32

item.title: QuarksPwDump Clearing Access History
item.description: Detects QuarksPwDump clearing access history in hive

item.title: Registry Dump of SAM Creds and Secrets
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to extract credential material from the Security Account Manager (SAM) database either through Windows Registry where the SAM database is stored

item.title: Registry Parse with Pypykatz
item.description: Adversaries may attempt to extract credential material from the Security Account Manager (SAM) database either through Windows Registry where the SAM database is stored

item.title: Remote Registry Management Using Reg Utility
item.description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation

item.title: Shadow Copies Access via Symlink
item.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities

item.title: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access

item.title: SilentProcessExit Monitor Registrytion for LSASS
item.description: Detects changes to the Registry in which a monitor program gets registered to dump process memory of the lsass.exe process memory

item.title: Suspicious Export-PfxCertificate
item.description: Detects Commandlet that is used to export certificates from the local certificate store and sometimes used by threat actors to steal private keys from compromised machines

item.title: Suspicious Get-ADReplAccount
item.description: The DSInternals PowerShell Module exposes several internal features of Active Directory and Azure Active Directory. These include FIDO2 and NGC key auditing, offline ntds.dit file manipulation, password auditing, DC recovery from IFM backups and password hash calculation.

item.title: Suspicious History File Operations
item.description: Detects commandline operations on shell history files

item.title: Suspicious History File Operations
item.description: Detects commandline operations on shell history files

item.title: Suspicious Kerberos RC4 Ticket Encryption
item.description: Detects service ticket requests using RC4 encryption type

item.title: Suspicious PFX File Creation
item.description: A general detection for processes creating PFX files. This could be an indicator of an adversary exporting a local certificate to a PFX file.

item.title: Suspicious Rejected SMB Guest Logon From IP
item.description: Detect Attempt PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-1675) Remote code execution in Windows Spooler Service

item.title: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage
item.description: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.

item.title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares
item.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares - Zeek
item.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Unsigned Image Loaded Into LSASS Process
item.description: Loading unsigned image (DLL, EXE) into LSASS process

item.title: Volume Shadow Copy Mount
item.description: Detects volume shadow copy mount

item.title: VSSAudit Security Event Source Registration
item.description: Detects the registration of the security event source VSSAudit. It would usually trigger when volume shadow copy operations happen.
